alert.note: Alert for Humacao; Maunabo; Patillas; Yabucoa (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 09 at 10:53AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AST TODAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Humacao, Maunabo, Patillas and Yabucoa. * WHEN...Until noon AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1047 AM AST, Doppler radar indicate that the heavy rain has ended. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, and additional rainfall amounts are not anticipated. However, excessive runoff from previous rains is causing urban and small stream flooding, and local rivers (Rio Maunabo and Rio Guayanes) are still running high. For this reason, the Flash Flood Warning was downgraded to a Flood Advisory, until flood waters and streamflows recede.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
